code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:a 56 yr old white M environmental scientist presents with moderate abdominal pain x 7 weeks. pt also complains of moderate nausea. o:Height 65 in, Weight 117 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to gastroenterology.

s:patient complains of moderate abdominal pain for 10 days. NKDA. he is a 56 YO white male environmental scientist. o:Height 65 in, Weight 116 lbs, Temperature 98.8 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 15, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and ordered CT Abdomen.

s:pt presents with moderate nausea x 3 days. patient also complains of moderate abdominal pain. he is a male environmental scientist aged 56 yrs. he does not smoke he drinks alcohol occasionally o:Height 66 in, Weight 120 lbs, Temperature 99.2 F, Pulse 75, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 19, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed prochlorperazine - 25 mg daily (rectal dose), and ordered CT Abdomen.
Do not IV Fluid and Support
